alert.note: Alert for Calumet; Manitowoc; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 1:52PM CST until January 19 at 12:00PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...SNOW TO PRODUCE HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS TONIGHT INTO THURSDAY... .Low pressure tracking from northern Missouri to the central Lower Michigan will bring snow to the area tonight and Thursday. The snow may taper to drizzle or freezing drizzle as it diminishes Thursday. The snow will result in hazardous travel conditions, especially for the Thursday morning commute. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Snow accumulation of 4 to 6 inches expected. * WHERE...Calumet, Manitowoc, and Winnebago Counties. * WHEN...From Midnight tonight to Noon CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Heavy snow in the pre-dawn hours will result in hazardous conditions for the Thursday morning commute.
info.instruction: Travel conditions are expected to become hazardous, especially for the Thursday morning commute. Be sure to allow for plenty of extra travel time. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
